title: Skirt, early 20th century
medium:
Medium: raffia palm fiber
Technique: resist dyed
dimensions: H x W: 61 x 289.6 cm (24 in. x 9 ft. 6 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Anonymous, Dr. and Mrs. Lewis Balamuth, Mr. and Mrs. Dewitt Clinton Cohen, Gertrude Crownfeld, Valerie Dreyfus, Norvin Hewitt Green, Rodman A. Heeren, Misses Hewitt, Sarah Cooper Hewitt, Florence N. Levy, Mrs. Paul C. Pennoyer, Mrs. Harry T. Peters, Mrs. Bernard Reis, Mrs. William Jay Schieffelin, and Mr. and Mrs. Stephens B. Stanton
description: A man's ceremonial dance skirt with two panels of red and brown and two of tan and brown that are sewn together to form one long panel. All panels have interlacing patterns created through resist-dyeing.
